headline: Prince Harry's emotional avalanche hits the Royal Family
context: This BBC interview with Prince Harry will become one of those famous moments when television collides with the world of the royals.

It was like an emotional avalanche. It began with some stones being kicked over with questions about security and then the interview turned into a spectacular release of what seemed to be a rolling mountain of pent-up frustration and a poignant sense of separation.

annotations.paragraph: The starting point was Prince Harry's defeat in the courts as he sought to overturn a downgrading of his security in the UK. He seemed wounded. Had he decided it was time to have his say? And then really say some more?
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context about the court case that triggered Prince Harry's emotional revelations.

annotations.paragraph: A conversation about security was suddenly becoming about a whole range of insecurities.
annotations.reason: This paragraph highlights the shift in the interview's focus from security to broader personal issues.

annotations.paragraph: Prince Harry looked upset, it seemed a cry from the heart when he said that his father "won't speak to me because of this security stuff", even though he didn't know "how much longer my father has".
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides a direct quote from Prince Harry, illustrating the emotional impact on his relationship with his father.

annotations.paragraph: This was a first-hand confirmation of the scale of the rift in the Royal Family. There was also the lack of contact between his children and their wider family in the UK. He was "gutted" and "devastated" and tired of only coming home for funerals and court cases.
annotations.reason: This paragraph offers specific details about the family rift and Prince Harry's feelings of isolation.

annotations.paragraph: And like all family rows, there was a balancing act between wanting to air grievances, to throw emotional punches, and then still want to get back together and hug and make friends.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides a generalization about family dynamics without adding new information.

annotations.paragraph: So Prince Harry talked of the downgrading in his security in terms of this family dispute, suggesting that the Royal Household had influenced the decision, using security as leverage to keep him within the Royal Family.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides new facts about Prince Harry's claims regarding security and family disputes.

annotations.paragraph: Then he talked with great frankness, sounding like a slightly homesick son stuck overseas, when he spoke about wanting reconciliation. "There's no point continuing to fight any more. Life is precious," he said, holding out an olive branch the size of a small palace.
annotations.reason: This paragraph includes direct quotes and commentary on Prince Harry's desire for reconciliation.

annotations.paragraph: The "sticking point" for reconciliation is security when he visits the UK, said Prince Harry. And as well as calling on his father the King to help resolve this, he also called on the prime minister and home secretary to intervene.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific details about the security issue and Prince Harry's calls for intervention.

annotations.paragraph: At that point, it's worth stepping away from the drama and taking a cold draught of unemotive legal air, from the judge who ruled against Prince Harry on Friday afternoon.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is a filler that does not add new information to the main story.

annotations.paragraph: Sir Geoffrey Vos told the court that Prince Harry's "sense of grievance" did not add up to the same thing as a legal argument. He upheld the decision that security arrangements had been changed because Prince Harry's circumstances had changed, he was no longer a working royal and no longer living in the UK.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides relevant legal context and the court's decision regarding Prince Harry's security arrangements.

annotations.paragraph: It might have annoyed Prince Harry, but the courts had again rejected his claim about unfair treatment.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context about Prince Harry's legal struggles, which is relevant to the emotional impact on the Royal Family.

annotations.paragraph: There was also a response from Buckingham Palace that sounded like a weary parent.
annotations.reason: This paragraph offers insight into the Royal Family's reaction, which is relevant to the main story.

annotations.paragraph: "All of these issues have been examined repeatedly and meticulously by the courts, with the same conclusion reached on each occasion."
annotations.reason: This quote provides direct commentary from the Palace, relevant to the ongoing legal issues.

annotations.paragraph: It wouldn't be right for the King to wade into issues being reviewed by the courts and considered by government departments, suggested the Palace.
annotations.reason: This paragraph explains the King's stance on the legal matters, relevant to the main story.

annotations.paragraph: While Prince Harry wore his frustration on his sleeve in this interview, you have to wonder how the rest of his family will privately respond to this outburst, with this story ricocheting around the world, on billions of mobile phones and TV screens.
annotations.reason: This paragraph speculates on the family's reaction, which is relevant to the emotional impact on the Royal Family.

annotations.paragraph: These clips are going to be seen again and again. Netflix would have spun it out into a mini-series.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is speculative and does not provide new information about the interview or its impact.

annotations.paragraph: VE Day 80 is coming up next week, with the Royal Family prominent at commemorations. But the public might still be thinking of Prince Harry's accusations about them. How will that work alongside messages of togetherness and unity?
annotations.reason: This paragraph connects the interview's impact to upcoming events involving the Royal Family, providing relevant context.

annotations.paragraph: Like in all families, arguments can go back a long way. And Prince Harry's testimony was disarmingly candid, restlessly baring his feelings, and suggesting that his departure from the UK was still unresolved.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides insight into Prince Harry's candidness and unresolved feelings, directly related to the interview's content.

annotations.paragraph: He was looking back with some uncertainty at home, and the question now will be how people at home look back at him.
annotations.reason: This paragraph reflects on the potential public perception of Prince Harry following the interview, relevant to the article's theme.
